items.doc: Tom said 'Hi!' Jerry said 'What is your favorite holiday?' Tom said 'one where I get to meet lots of different people.' Jerry said 'What was the most number of people you have ever met during a holiday?' Tom said 'Hard to keep a count. Maybe 25.' Jerry said 'Which holiday was that?' Tom said 'I think it was Australia.' Jerry said 'Do you still talk to the people you met?' Tom said 'Not really. The interactions are usually short-lived but it's fascinating to learn where people are coming from and what matters to them.' Jerry said 'Yea, me too. I feel like God often puts strangers in front of you, and gives you an opportunity to connect with them in that moment in deeply meaningful ways. Do you ever feel like you know things about strangers without them telling you?' Tom said 'what do you mean?' Jerry said 'I think it's like a 6th sense, often seen as "cold readings" to people, but can be remarkably accurate. I once sat next to a man in a coffee and I felt a pain in my back. I asked the stranger if he had a pain. It turns out that he did in the exact spot, and said he pulled a muscle while dancing at a party. I had never met the man before and never saw him again.' Tom said 'Wow! That's interesting, borderline spooky.' Jerry said 'There's this practice called "Treasure Hunting" that's kind of a fun game you play in a public place. There's a book called "The Ultimate Treasure Hunt" that talks about it. You use your creativity to imagine people you will meet, and you write down a description, then you associate them with a positive message or encouraging word. Maybe you saw a teenage boy in a red hat at the shopping mall in your imagination, then while at the mall, you may find someone who matches that description. You show that you have a message for him and that you have a message for a boy in a red hat. You then give him a message of kindness or whatever was on your heart. You have no idea, sometimes you meet someone who is having a really hard day, and it brings them to tears to have a stranger show them love.'
items.question: What was the most number of people Tom has met during a holiday?

items.doc: Tom said 'Hi!' Jerry said 'Do you believe in miracles?' Tom said 'Lol. No. I know too many people whose lives suck.' Jerry said 'Should we be helping them, so it sucks less?\' Tom said 'It's too many of them out there. You help who you can. I haven't gone through the process of shaping my values. What about you?' Jerry said 'I'd say that I want to live for the best possible world in my lifetime. It's probably a result of my playing too many video games as a child.' Tom said 'We didn't have electricity growing up. Explains a lot. Lol.' Jerry said 'Does not having had electricity help you empathize more with people of differing backgrounds and/or makes you feel a bit a distance from those who don't understand?' Tom said 'It makes it easier to empathise with people who grew up lacking things. Not sure it makes me empathise with people in general. Where did you grow up?' Jerry said 'I grew up in the United States, but my parents were immigrants and ended up being scammed of all their money, so we moved to Taiwan to live with family for a little bit.' Tom said 'ALL THEIR MONEY? By a person or an organisation?' Jerry said 'I was kind of too young to really understand, but apparently there are people who scam Asian immigrants into investing in their own restaurant business. I know that the other part of it was that my mom got sick/hospitalized, and we didn't have insurance. To be honest, I don't really know what really happened versus what my parents want people to think. I just know that one minute I was in the US, and then they put me on a plane to Taiwan, and I never saw my stuff again. In some ways, it made me more sentimental.'
items.question: Where did Jerry's family move after being scammed?

items.doc: Tom said 'Hi!' Jerry said 'Hello. Deja Vu.' Tom said 'what does that mean?' Jerry said 'It's French for "already seen." I know it's used when you see something for the second time or you have the feeling that something has happened before and you're re-experiencing it.' Tom said 'Interesting. I get that feeling sometimes. It just feels that the event is replaying. Wonder why it happens?' Jerry said 'I think it's your mind lapsing somehow.' Tom said 'How do you know so much about this French phrase?' Jerry said 'I thought it was common. I hear it a lot in popular culture - movies music etc. Jay Z has a song called Deja Vu, so does Beyonce. So I looked it up one time. It's one of those phrases that was carried over exactly to english like "etcetera" "vice versa" "savior faire" and so on. I like cool word origin facts.' Tom said 'yeah... that's pretty insightful. Never thought of etcetera that way before.' Jerry said 'My favourite word origins are gymnasium and jazz.' Tom said 'wdym by word origins here?' Jerry said 'First usage and original meaning. Gymnasium meant place of nakedness and had very little to do with working out. Jazz comes from jism which means semen and was originally sporadic sex music now it's elitist, high art.' Tom said 'Very interesting. I learned a lot in this conversation today üôÇ' Jerry said 'You got any cool facts?' Tom said 'My friend used to tell me this and found it funny - Mosquitos have 47 teeths.' Jerry said 'That was quite a laughter!!!' Tom said 'Tell me a joke!' Jerry said 'Google for that:)'
